subject: how many tests on a method - all possible scenarios or just enough?
msgSnippet: I ve started investigating JUnit and I m finding that for methods in my application that have some non trivial logic (basically multiple if paths through the
messageBody:
I've started investigating JUnit and I'm finding that for methods in my
application that have some non trivial logic (basically multiple if paths
through the method) that my JUnit tests are becoming unwieldy to setup and
maintain. I'm retrofitting unit tests onto an existing large J2EE app.

For the method below, where cust.location can be UK or US and cust.status
can be any one of STATUS_ONE, STATUS_TWO, STATUS_THREE, what junit tests
would you have? I'm interested to see what the gurus interpretation of this
is .

I'd would have

1) testStoreAddress_status_is_ONE_location_is_UK()
2) testStoreAddress_status_is_TWO_location_is_UK()
3) testStoreAddress_status_is_TWO_location_is_US()

My thinking is:
a) I only need to setup scenario where cust.status is ONE and not ONE - I
don't need specific cases where cust.status is TWO and cust.status is THREE
because there is no checks for it being TWO or THREE
b) I don't need a test where status is ONE and location is US because there
are no if() statements in the method that query these values for status &
location.
c) As I add more code to the method I add the relevant unit tests to cover
them


public void storeAddress(Customer customer)
{
if (cust.status == Customer.STATUS_ONE)
{
executeSQL("store_customer");
executeSQL("update_some_other_table");
}
else
{
executeSQL("store_customer");
if (cust.location.equals("UK"))
{
executeSQL("store_locaion_UK");
}
}

if (cust.location.equals("US"))
{
executeSQL("store_location_US");
}
}
